review:
Nice

Samsung is back with Note 8 .. I have been using it for the past 9 days ..Its
very evident that they have rectified all their previous mistakes esp battery
issue with note7 .. Note 8 is the best from the note series so far ..

Beast of a phone.. A Phoenix reborn from the Ashes (of Note 7 last year) .. A
new boss in the Android arena..  
Almost all pros and negligible cons:  
\+ Premium built and feel.  
\+ Doesn't look that big in spite of having an above 6 inch screen.  
\+ Superb cameras, hands down one of the best, if not the best. Live focus
mode is clearly superior to the similar options in other phones. Low light
performance is top-notch.  
\+ Samsung software looks better than ever.  
\+ Bixby requires some getting used to, but it builds over time and has some
unique features up its sleeve due to its deep integration with the phone
hardware and software.  
\+ S-Pen is one of the key factors that distinguish this phone from the crowd.
The pen has some nifty features that make your tasks very easy and convenient.
Loved it.  
\+ In spite of having a somewhat lower battery capacity (compared to previous
year note and the S8+), the battery backup is good (if not the best). It's
sufficient for a day's moderate use and then some in the night. Recommend
one'd charge it each night. It's not a hassle considering the fast charger
provided with the phone is a great one. Takes my phone around 1Hr40Mins to
fully charge from 0 to 100.  
\+ Multitasking on this phone is a piece of cake thanks mainly to its advanced
processor (exynos 8895 for India and Snapdragon 835 for US) and mammoth 6gb
RAM.  
  
\- The front and back is a fingerprint magnet. One has to clean it regularly
if not using a cover.  
\- One handed use of the full screen is somewhat difficult (however, the one
handed mode in the settings and some other intelligent provisions provide
alternative options for that).

Another valuable addition to the Samsung family. Upgrading to the Note8 after
using the Note II for 4 years and it is a totally different experience
altogether. Whether or not it is better than iPhone X is arguable, but it is
definitely better than all other phones out there in the market. After having
used the phone for more than a month now, here are a few pros and cons that I
find about this phone.  
Pros:  
1\. Huge 6.3 inch Super AMOLED QHD+ Display with a tall 18.5:9 aspect ratio
easily beats any display in the market and will make you fall in love with it
almost instantly.  
2\. The S Pen is a Galaxy Note series exclusive stylus pen that has a lot of
handy features.  
3\. The latest Exynos Octa 8895 processor is a heavy duty performer and gives
absolutely no lag at all.  
4\. The 12 MP +12 MP Dual Pixel Dual Camera, along with the 8 MP Front Camera
make the photography experience one of the best in the market.  
5\. USB Type-C Fast Charging makes the phone charge really fast. And it is
included in the box, unlike Apple's latest devices where you have to purchase
it separately. Wireless charger though is sold separately, which is also a
cool purchase.  
  
Cons:  
1\. Though the display is mesmerizing, the 1440p display sucks out a lot of
power and the battery doesn't last long. Note phones were known to be huge
battery carriers, but sadly 3300 mAh on this device just isn't enough.  
2\. The all glass body, though premium looking, is prone to breakeage. If you
want your phone to last long, a case and a tempered glass is a must.  
  
Despite a few cons, the pros for this device makes up for it. And the Note8 is
definitely a great phone, which will certainly not disappoint.

Well after using Note 8 for 2 weeks plus find it absolutely fit in every

to use no size issue. Buy it if you are truly multitasking person who uses
spen a lot.price is high but what to do its samsung.rest is good .

Coming from stock Android, I would say I am really impressed with this
device...Samsung bloatware has been diluted down to the minimum I have ever
seen on a Samsung device... !! The S-Pen works great. It is altogether a
different feeling when you are working with the Note 8. Small nifty little
tweaks here and there adds to the cherry on the cake... :) The camera is one
of the best smartphones cameras available as of writing this.  
  
I did however notice some lags over my period of usage (been 5 days). But that
can be fixed via an OTA update.  
  
The only problem however, is the BATTERY life. During my normal usage it lasts
for about 6-7 hrs...Where in I make phone calls...Surf the
internet....Whatsapp mesages...Some social networking....etc...I need to
charge it once a while...  
  
But I think Samsung played it safe here...After what happened with the Note 7
!!  
  
Overall for people who can afford this device, do it without the blink of a
thought !!

I have replaced my last phone Note 3 with the latest iteration of Note series.
I purchased the phone last month and my insights are limited to the use cases
that any general phone user would have. Following are my thoughts categorized
into Pros and Cons:  
  
Pros:  
* AWESOME Display: I am love with the crispness, sharpness, and vibrancy of color gamut displayed on the screen. The screen is Big and takes time to get used to, but within 1 week, I felt every other phone around me had a sub-par display (including 1plus5T). It's very hard to like anything else after this.  
* Performance: I have played a couple of games and often forgot to close apps once I am done using them. Often they are minimized or running in the background. At one point, I had 15+ apps running subsequently and I didn't even notice any performance issues while using the phone. I accidentally noticed the # of apps running and I was pleasantly surprised with the device's performance. I have come to realize that "A new redefined but familiar Samsung OS+Exynos Processor + 6GB of Ram" is a deadly combination that's built to last. I can easily foresee that the phone will be relevant for next 3 years at least. This in a way justifies its high price against some lower end phones which start to show their true color within 1yr.  
* Camera: I have taken stunning pictures of my daughter using Note 8 in broad daylight; and I say this even though I own a mid-range DSLR. The camera has performed brilliantly under natural light conditions. The camera has also performed quite wonderfully in the night as well, particularly under artificial light at home. The Dual Camera takes two images under live view setup and that's a nice to have feature. The Bokeh effect produced by software is very impressive and doesn't look gimmicky. However the camera has been a bit disappointing in extremely low light conditions and that's understandable as I was expecting a lot from a smartphone; then I do have a DSLR which would take over where Note 8 fails. On a side note, I have seen Google Pixel XL2 take great low light images - something that Note 8 can't give you. But as they say, there is nothing called "a perfect phone".  
* Water Proof and Dust Proof: The phone is IP68 certified which means it is dust and waterproof. I play outdoor games and often the corners and edges where the back cover fits attract a lot of dust particles. To freak my wife, I often wash the phone with tap water to clean the dust and screen finger print marks. The look on her face is priceless. Lol ;) But having a phone which can resist elementary conditions around us is a definite plus for me.  
  
Cons:  
* Battery Backup: I wish I had more juice in battery which would make 100% charged phone last beyond a day. As I mentioned earlier, I am not hooked on the phone 24 x 7 but I do my share of gameplay, YouTube streaming, texting, browsing on the phone. I start my day with 99% charge and end my day with 13% left on my battery. I would say that's around average given other smartphones comfortably last more than 1 day (for example, Google Pixel XL 2).  
* The speaker of the phone is a disappointment. I had better and louder sound output from Note 3. I don't know why Samsung didn't give front facing speakers like other phones have. It's puzzling.  
* Finger Print Scanner: It's virtually nonexistent for me given its position right beside the camera lens. I have mostly used the Facial recognition to unlock the phone. Only in low light conditions or dark conditions, I have tried using Fingerprint sensor on the back to unlock the phone. The facial recognition works like a charm but it's definitely not as fast the one which One Plus 5T has (which is lightning fast).  
* In order to protect the screen, there are no good screen guards/tempered-glass options available. I have wasted 2k in trying different screen guards only to find that the touch sensitivity of the phone is reduced after putting on the guard. I have found some screen good guards in USA, but those are extremely expensive (~$50). As of now, I am extremely careful while handling the phone especially when I am walking or talking.  
  
Overall I am happy with my purchase. I had to choose between Google Pixel XL 2
and Note 8, and I wanted Note 8 for its bright display and comparable
performance. The camera isn't too far behind the Pixel 2. As I said, there is
nothing called "a perfect phone." All phones have various deltas which can be
improved. Somewhere I feel that's a strategy which Samsung, Apple, and Google
adapt - to release the phone with some obvious flaws and deltas. I mean, "Does
it makes sense to put the fingerprint scanner next to cameras? Who was the
design architect of this phone? I want to meet him" :O :O  
And of course, the next iteration has those deltas fixed and lures the
customer towards them. For me, I​ am not looking at a smartphone for the next
3 years at least.

An amazing piece of Engineering. The Note 8 is a complete package offering the
finest display, an amazing camera and utilities for both work and personal
use. The S-Pen is an added advantage, with the 4k cash back when you buy it
with a HDFC credit card every penny worth. I was an iPhone user till today and
my first Android!

review:
The Samsung Galaxy Note 8 is the best big phone you can buy. For once, it’s
more than just the size of the screen and the power of the S Pen that count.
It also captures superior telephoto and bokeh-rich photos with its new dual-
lens array, and it clocks in faster with 6GB of RAM.  
  
There a price to pay, however. It’s a taller phone with a steeper price tag.
It takes a lot of finger-stretching to reach the outer edges of the screen,
and costs more money than any previous Note phone. You’re also only getting
all-day battery life that’s lower than expected, probably thanks to last
year’s recall. It’s less, shall we say, Note-worthy.  
  
The Note 8 is Samsung’s big phone homecoming, its dual-lens camera debut and
its 6GB of RAM premier wrapped into one. It makes quite an entrance. Let’s
just hope it doesn’t make another quick exit.  
  
Who’s it for?  
  
Can you handle the Note 8 size and price? Yes? Then this phone is for you.
There’s more screen than ever, it has the best camera on a phone and you can’t
slow it down. It’s Samsung’s best – but it can’t be recommended to everyone.  
  
Upgrading from an old Note? It’s a big jump from 2015’s Note 5 (well
technically :P), the last Note with more than a two-month lifespan. So it's
basically like upgrading to the future with futuristic inflation rates applied
as well.

This Note is surely going to replace PC's... It's humongous, it's powerful,
it's classy...

review:
I just love this Phone. I am a fan of Samsung Note Series. I am using note
since 2011 and I must say that Samsung is an Innovation in Mobile category.
You need to be smart enough to use this phone because if you are an
avg/ordinary user like you whatsapping most of the time then this is not a
phone for ordinary people. This phone is a feature pack of several other
things, it's a powerful multimedia phone.  
Sleek in design and Camera is just awesome, I would say if you are planning to
buy a camera under 35K then better purchase Note 8 but you need to possess bit
of photographic skill to use Pro mode, I have used the pro mode and trust me
what a brilliance Note 8 just clicks.

Even though screen is 6.3 inch, its still 75% comfortable for single handed
use  
Battery is only 3300 mAh but easily gets you through 1 day but not more than
that!  
Screen is the major selling point of this phone and damn its gorgeous  
Camera takes decent shots and I have no complaints  
UI is bit dull so switched to Microsoft launcher  
Good reception and crisp sound quality (but not as loud as iPhone)  
SPen might not be useful for everyone but it definitely helps even in small
tasks like taking screen clips etc  
Got December security patch, so is secured from most known vulnerability  
Got Rs. 8K cashback as Amazon pay balance :)

review:
Portrait mode on note 8 is breath taking  
Excellent camera

Best decision ever , the new design philosophy of Samsung makes even the s7
edge look dated , the footprint of the device is not the big but the screen is
gorgeous. It's. Treat to watch a 2k video  
The real deal is the camera : dual camera captures brilliant photos in well
lit environments , however once it gets dark the live focus uses the primary
f1.7 lens to induce the depth effect which is not so good, anyways, the low
light performance throws iPhone X out of water , iPhone lacks low light
performance whereas this one masters it .  
Camera can also be used underwater but the deal breaker is the screen gets
random touch inputs under water .  
The Spen which I thought I would never use ; is quite a useful TOOL ; helps in
taking notes at any point in time without reaching for the notepad and a pen .
One tight that was not available out of the box was the action memo which was
present on note 5 ; and note 8 comes with a 3.5 mm headphone jack where you
can plug in the supplied pair of amazing earphones from Harman Kadon's AKG
which retail for 6k ; in the box .  
And you get dual sim and memory expansion slot both of which are missing on
the iPhone X

A complete set of package. I must say you never get bored of this phone

Note 8 is beast just waiting for free wireless charger..

I have never used an android phone before but after the disappointment of the
iPhone X, decided to take this plunge and I dont regret this for one minute!
The screen is a pleasure to watch and the performance is no doubt stellar.
Don't be fooled by the 3300 mah battery as the phone lasts all day easily even
with heavy use. I respond to work mails all day and am still left with 25-30%
by the end of the day.  
  
The only downside I see is that the wait for the free wireless charger is too
long.

Everything is as promised and in time delivery as well, but the pre order free
charger system is non sense and tedious! Shud have just shipped it together
but I am sure its so annoying that they know many would forget or not be able
to do the entire process due to time constraints and hence will not even take
it!  
  
Phone is excellent and the free case inside the box is also excellent so try
before u buy another case.
